title: Drake Maye hosted a free football clinic while vacationing in Hawaii
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye led a free football clinic for high school athletes in Kealakekua, Hawaii during his vacation.
The clinic, organized by Rich Miano and SAP, involved 50 quarterbacks, receivers, and three girls flag football players.
Maye, the 2025 NFL MVP runner-up, conducted drills and shared insights on footwork, throwing mechanics, and route trees.

title: How well do you know Matt Damon and Ben Affleck? Take this quiz to find out.
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck and Matt Damon took a friendship quiz for GQ, covering their 40-year relationship.
The quiz by Boston.com highlights Affleck and Damon's shared roots in Cambridge and their collaborative projects.
Damon and Affleck started their careers by writing and starring in 'Good Will Hunting' in 1997.

title: Review & setlist: Conan Gray’s ‘Wishbone’ tour brought a coming-of-age story to TD Garden
author: Shannon Murphy
bullets: Conan Gray performed at TD Garden in Boston as part of his 'Wishbone' tour promoting his fourth album.
The concert was divided into four acts, each exploring themes like heartbreak and growth through visual storytelling.
Gray's setlist included hits like 'Heather,' 'Maniac,' and 'Vodka Cranberry,' with a surprise song unique to Boston.

title: 8 hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on Cape Cod
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Eight people were hospitalized for carbon monoxide poisoning on a boat at MacMillan Pier in Provincetown.
Provincetown Police and Fire Departments responded to the incident on Thursday, Feb. 26, and declared a mass-casualty event.
A recent blizzard left parts of Provincetown without power, contributing to the carbon monoxide incident.

title: Topsfield massage parlor shut down over alleged prostitution, trafficking
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Topsfield Police and multiple agencies shut down FeiFei L Spa for alleged prostitution and human trafficking.
A search warrant was executed at the spa located at 461 Boston St. on Wednesday after a lengthy investigation.
The business owner received a cease-and-desist order; criminal charges are pending as the investigation continues.

title: Charlie Coyle thankful for Bruins tenure in first game back with Boston
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie Coyle returned to Boston with the Columbus Blue Jackets for the first time since leaving the Bruins.
Coyle contributed significantly to Boston Bruins, playing seven seasons and helping them reach the 2019 Stanley Cup Final.
During his Boston return, Coyle received a video tribute from the TD Garden crowd, reflecting on his tenure with the Bruins.

title: Amid trying year, Olympic gold shone even brighter for Charlie McAvoy and his family
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy won Olympic gold with Team USA, celebrating with family in Milan after a challenging year.
McAvoy overcame a shoulder injury, jaw fracture, and personal trials before the Olympics.
Team USA won thanks to McAvoy's defensive efforts, including a perfect penalty kill performance.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston stories.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor, curates the quiz, active since 2019.
The quiz covers trending topics, helping readers stay informed about local news developments.

title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Providence goalie Michael DiPietro briefly played for the Bruins following a scare with starting goalie Joonas Korpisalo against Columbus.
Korpisalo left the game due to a suspected concussion but returned to play shortly after, securing 36 out of 38 saves.
DiPietro was called as an emergency backup, playing 6:03 and stopping two shots until Korpisalo's return.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, arrested for reckless murder of her infant found dead in Pine Island Pond, Manchester, N.H.
Child referred to as Baby Jane Doe discovered deceased on March 27, 2025; police sought public assistance for leads.
Manchester police increased reward for information from $2,500 to $5,000 during the investigation last April.
